instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00138 - PPBUS_G3H Shorted to ground, also PPVIN_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS
threads.message:
hey guys

820-00138, very minor liquid damage at U7310, on pin 8, 9, 10, 11, 12, 13, 14, and the small capacitors around there, replaced everything, except U7310, PPVIN_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS short to ground, Diode mode shows 0.000, 

also PPBUS_G3H is shorted to ground as well, when i plug in the power cord, CPU Warms up, 

Dead CPU? or do you guys have any ideas? Should i replace U7310 First?

also i took out U7310, and Pin 43 is Showing 0.000 at diode mode

Thank you guys in advance.

threads.title: 820-00138 - PPBUS_G3H Shorted to ground, also PPVIN_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS
threads.message: Dead CPU. U7310 getting liquid means the CPU got a spike of 12 volts and died instantly. RIP.
